answers.answer: Hi there!It is normal for one testicle to be smaller than the other. Well, without a clinical evaluation it would be difficult to determine the cause of the spot.. Possibilities that may need to be considered include infections, primary skin conditions, micronutrient deficiencies, cysts, growths etc. This might require an evaluation by a dermatologist for an accurate diagnosis and appropriate management. Erectile dysfunction can develop in young adults due to a variety of causes. Psychological stress, performance anxiety, depression, neurogenic disorders peyronie's disease, body image issues, medications, alcohol, smoking, drugs/medications, hormonal imbalance, radiation therapy, kidney failure, metabolic disorders, multiple sclerosis, hypertension, diabetes, prostatitis, urethritis etc. just to name a few. Anxiety and stress play an important role in adolescents in the development of erectile dysfunction; and is the most common possible cause. At a primary level, I would suggest being a bit relaxed and working on the psychological factors with your partner. It might also be beneficial to get rid of factors like smoking/ alcohol/ drugs, if involved. In case this doesn’t work, or you have difficulty controlling anxiety; I would suggest seeing your primary care physician for an evaluation of the above mentioned causes and appropriate specific treatment.Hope this helps.Take care!

question: Im 61year.I have noticed white oval shape spot on my penis. Left testical is slight smaller than right. When i go for urin my penis become large and thoch. But when I coplet process it becoms small .I have lost sex power. I want to intercourse but i can not. Even if I try and after penetration it becoms loose. What should I do?Kindly suggest me some remedy.Thanking you.
title: Spots on my Penis and loss power of sex.
